title: rxalts
author: rxalts
created_time: September 13, 2022, 03:51:59 AMLast edit: September 16, 2022, 09:00:42 PM by rxalts
content: Up for sale is my recently purchased 2016 Lealana 100 XMR #20 Silver/Gilt 1oz MS68 PL, as I have had a change in heart of XMRAs I wish to sell this quickly given the minimal premium expected, I will be accepting offers over the next 48 hours. If a deal is not made within 48 hours, I will peel the coin and auction off the peeled coin in a separate thread. Simply want to give any collectors out there a chance at a funded version if desired   feel free to make offers in thread or via PM*Digital COAs and paper error sheets for the silvers will be supplied to buyer*PAYMENT: BTC or XMR.SHIPPING: Free within USA, at cost for international shipments

comments.author: Kryptowerk
comments.body: Please somebody buy this thing, to peel is to sin!

comments.author: rxalts
comments.body: Got antsy and peeled. Unfortunately, the quality of the private key is so bad that multiple letters are faded and I have been unable to unlock the wallet with over 25 potential combinations. Incoming thread/photos if/when I can finally redeem.

comments.author: MoparMiningLLC
comments.body: Quote from: rxalts on September 14, 2022, 12:10:58 AMGot antsy and peeled. Unfortunately, the quality of the private key is so bad that multiple letters are faded and I have been unable to unlock the wallet with over 25 potential combinations. Incoming thread/photos if/when I can finally redeem.let me know if I can assist - I have had some pretty bad ones too.

comments.author: Kryptowerk
comments.body: Quote from: rxalts on September 14, 2022, 12:10:58 AMGot antsy and peeled. Unfortunately, the quality of the private key is so bad that multiple letters are faded and I have been unable to unlock the wallet with over 25 potential combinations. Incoming thread/photos if/when I can finally redeem.This is horrible news and should be a bigger topic.Are Lealana coins known for having bad privatekey prints in general or is this a strange oddity?

comments.author: owlcatz
comments.body: Quote from: Kryptowerk on September 14, 2022, 09:33:11 PMThis is horrible news and should be a bigger topic.Are Lealana coins known for having bad privatekey prints in general or is this a strange oddity?In my experience, never had one with any issue in the end - usually it's a font thing like 1 vs l , q vs 9... the font is not super easy to read, I've had a few times it took a number of tries to get it correctly.

comments.author: rxalts
comments.body: I have included the first picture I took of the private key with the most severely blemished sections shown, this picture was taken while the key was still under the foil and attached to coin as I immediately noticed the faded font Furthermore, there are characters like this which are slightly blemished which appears to be Zk? but if its zk or 2k that's another few hundred guesses added to the possibilitiesAnd as mentioned by owlcatz, there is also the issue of similar appearance of characters irrespective of ink status, such as this part of the PK which is crystal clear but I still have to try 1 vs l or even in the first picture 0 vs O vs o.  I believe there are well over 2000 potential combinations based on character similarities of which I have already tried ~300 of what I felt were the most likely characters  The PK paper has remained untouched with the PK facing upwards since removal. However, ink has actually further faded to the point where the last 3 characters in the first image above are no longer distinguishable (I would be entirely screwed had I not taken a picture yesterday). For reference: room temperature 68 degrees with humidity at 35%. The slab was cracked at the top and spliced down the side with no pressure on the coin.If anybody is able to adequately decipher the above characters/share photos of redeemed XMR private keys which allow me to successfully sweep the wallet without entering thousands of combinations, I am more than glad to offer the peeled XMR coin or 5 XMR as a token of my appreciation  , just shoot me a DM and I can share what I have already tried and a few other characters in question. Will post a separate summary thread to help future peelers as well

comments.author: Ballhog69
comments.body: Wonder if it's possible to figure out the font used, so you could see how the characters are supposed to look to help provide clues. Very sad thread for lealana/all funded coins

comments.author: krogoth
comments.body: Damn that's bad. Check your pm

comments.author: Cryptogreatdane
comments.body: Since smoothie is around right now. Maybe send him a message and ask if hell read the thread. At the very least he'll know the font i would imagine.

comments.author: smoothie
comments.body: @rxalts Font used was COURIER NEW on private keys and addresses printed.

comments.author: Kryptowerk
comments.body: Quote from: smoothie on September 14, 2022, 11:30:53 PM@rxalts Font used was COURIER NEW on private keys and addresses printed.Thanks for the prompt reply, also in your current main sales thread.Can you answer on the question if the printing technique used for these XMR coins was the same as for your previous releases (incl. BTC funded coins)?

comments.author: smoothie
comments.body: Quote from: Kryptowerk on September 14, 2022, 11:34:58 PMQuote from: smoothie on September 14, 2022, 11:30:53 PM@rxalts Font used was COURIER NEW on private keys and addresses printed.Thanks for the prompt reply, also in your current main sales thread.Can you answer on the question if the printing technique used for these XMR coins was the same as for your previous releases (incl. BTC funded coins)?The printing (laser printer and toner) has been the same through out all coin releases. The latest release has additional copy of private key.What may be different is the paper type for this specific coin type. I believe I had to use a thicker than normal paper for this series due to the depth at which the private key incused area was sunk into the coin. What has your experience been when redeeming Lealana coins?

comments.author: owlcatz
comments.body: Quote from: smoothie on September 14, 2022, 11:45:35 PMThe printing (laser printer and toner) has been the same through out all coin releases. The latest release has additional copy of private key.What may be different is the paper type for this specific coin type. I believe I had to use a thicker than normal paper for this series due to the depth at which the private key incused area was sunk into the coin. What has your experience been when redeeming Lealana coins? I have never seen anything like this, and over the years helped assist people peel at least 2 x 100 XMR coins, & few 25's and 50's, as well as many 5 XMR brasses ... Only issues I've run into are aforementioned troubles with deciphering / eyeing the lettering / fonts. Keys & Paper have always looked just fine otherwise. I have to wonder how this one may have been stored prior to grading.... /thinkface...This looks like something different, as I have to assume that Lealana would QC the privkey sticker/prints to ensure they are readable prior to sticking under holos ofc...  I also know that The Canary Thread by TeeGumes has one of these coins as well - I wonder how that project is going? hmmm.. PS - I have confidence you will eventually get it right - it's a pain because the wallet has to sync and you have to jump hoops etc, I get it, too...

comments.author: rxalts
comments.body: Thank you all for responses and to Smoothie for response here and in DM as I had asked this exact question before posting the pictures. I actually used Courier New last night as my comparison text on computer to no avail, however I will now laser print to see if I can match up the text on the physical PK.@owlcatz: would it be quicker to go base64->hexa->mnemonic and then import to mymonero/cake to see if I get the address printed on digital cert?

comments.author: smoothie
comments.created_time: September 15, 2022, 12:14:59 AMLast edit: September 15, 2022, 01:29:15 AM by smoothie
comments.body: here is a large version of the Base64 character combinations as well in COURIER NEW font.Perhaps this might help.I see a l70Swkawgorl705wkawgorl70Swkswg

comments.author: owlcatz
comments.body: Quote from: rxalts on September 15, 2022, 12:12:00 AMThank you all for responses and to Smoothie for response here and in DM as I had asked this exact question before posting the pictures. I actually used Courier New last night as my comparison text on computer to no avail, however I will now laser print to see if I can match up the text on the physical PK.@owlcatz: would it be quicker to go base64->hexa->mnemonic and then import to mymonero/cake to see if I get the address printed on digital cert?I think so, as I've never tried it without using this XMR CLI command then puting in the mnemonic myself.. Sorry! Code:c:\XMR\monero-wallet-cli.exe --restore-deterministic-wallet .... I just always did it that way and it works, so it seemed easiest at the time... Syncing it is the pita, but I guess there are other wallets out there that may be easier/faster nowadays...

comments.author: MoparMiningLLC
comments.body: Having tried to help rxalts for a while last night we did find the correct font. But some were so indistinguishable as to make it quite complicated. There were parts even worse than shown above. This is why I would suggest revlar paper or similar. I have had a pk on revlar soaking for over a year and its still perfectly readable.

comments.author: krogoth
comments.created_time: September 15, 2022, 01:12:57 AMLast edit: September 15, 2022, 02:47:14 PM by krogoth
comments.body: Quote from: MoparMiningLLC on September 15, 2022, 12:49:54 AMHaving tried to help rxalts for a while last night we did find the correct font. But some were so indistinguishable as to make it quite complicated. There were parts even worse than shown above. This is why I would suggest revlar paper or similar. I have had a pk on revlar soaking for over a year and its still perfectly readable.   Two years here under water....  TESTING- Submersing paper wallets printed on water proof papers   Edit:. One thing I do for all my loaded items is use water proof paper and have the private key in qr and alphanumeric format as well. I noticed some coin makers only have a qr code for their private keys IIRC.  What happens to that should it smudge or something like this happens? That's why I do both to make sure that issue never arises
